verses.text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yes, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
We hung our harps upon the willows in the midst of it.
For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us \add required of us\add* mirth, \add saying\add* , Sing us \add one\add* of the songs of Zion.
How shall we sing the LORD'S song in a foreign land?
If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget \add her skill\add* .
If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Raze \add it\add* , raze \add it\add* , \add even\add* to its foundation.
O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy \add shall he be\add* , that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.
Happy \add shall he be\add* , that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
